str2: Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
Not at any time, never. From mede and pote; not even ever.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
